## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}

tmp = dpc$spim$getSDropoutFreqency(codeTypes = c("LAD","NHSER","CTRY"))
tmp = tmp %>% mutate(gender = NA)
tmp = tmp %>% dpc$demog$findDemographics()

tmpMap = bind_rows(
  dpc$geog$getMap("LAD19") %>% as.data.frame() %>% ungroup() %>% select(code,area),
  dpc$geog$getMap("NHSER20") %>% as.data.frame() %>% ungroup() %>% select(code,area),
  dpc$geog$getMap("CTRY19") %>% as.data.frame() %>% ungroup() %>% select(code,area)
)

tmp = tmp %>% left_join(tmpMap,by="code")


heirarchy = dpc$codes$getTransitiveClosure() %>% filter(
  (fromCodeType == "LAD" & toCodeType == "NHSER") |
  (fromCodeType == "NHSER" & toCodeType == "CTRY")
) %>% group_by(fromCodeType, toCodeType) %>% distinct()

tmp = tmp %>% left_join(heirarchy %>% select(-fromCodeType), by=c("code"="fromCode"))

tmp %>% readr::write_csv("~/Dropbox/covid19/exports/sGeneSigmoidFitByHierarchicalGerographyRaw.csv")

#tmp %>% filter(mean > 0.2 & sGene=="Negative") %>% group_by(code,name,sGene) %>% arrange(date) %>% filter(row_number()==1) %>% View()

ggplot(tmp %>% filter(sGene=="Negative"),aes(x=date,group=name))+geom_line(aes(y=Roll.mean),alpha=0.2)

```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
